channel.title: New Build
channel.description:
So I'm building this computer for $700. I'm trying to save money on whatever I can so this is what I have so far:
Case - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811119077&cm_re=Case-_-11-119-077-_-Product $69.99 GPU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814134064&cm_re=GTX_250-_-14-134-064-_-Product $119.99 RAM - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231166 $94.99 MOBO - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813138156 $69.99 PSU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817709016&cm_re=PSU-_-17-709-016-_-Product $65.99 - $30.00 Rebate = $35.99 OS - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16832116515&cm_re=Windows_xp-_-32-116-515-_-Product $139.99 Case Fans[x2] - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835150007 $4.07 Total: $~650.00 + shipping = $~700.00
I need to buy the OS so don't tell me torrent or get Linux please. This is a gaming computer. I don't want suggestions on buying cases that include a psu because they normally don't go above 500w and they normally are cheap and blowout fairly quickly. I need suggestions how to improve the build or how to keep the build the same and save some money. Thanks. [You can also rate the build 1/10 :D] P.S: Since the case doesn't have room for these fans I plan to just mount them to the side of the case and hook them up. Will this still be effective? Thanks.

item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Such a crappy motherboard for such a good processor, whats going on here?

newegg.com

ASUS M4A77TD AM3 AMD 770 ATX AMD Motherboard - Newegg.com

Buy ASUS M4A77TD AM3 AMD 770 ATX AMD Motherboard with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

Woops. Here’s what I had

newegg.com

AMD Phenom II X2 550 Black Edition Callisto Dual-Core 3.1 GHz Socket AM3 80W...

Buy AMD Phenom II X2 550 Black Edition Callisto Dual-Core 3.1 GHz Socket AM3 80W HDZ550WFGIBOX Processor with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™


$102.00
Didn’t copy’n’paste throughly.

Total: 750

So I mean I can go to 750 but I’d like to stay at 700.

Read full topic

item.title: New Build
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Go ahead and get this. http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814133266&cm_re=gts_250--14-133-266--Product

Bestbuy is selling it for 129.99 without rebate but then you have to pay sales tax. So I would buy it from newegg and send in the rebate. You get 1gb vs 512mb, and its a name brand.

As the bank said you need a processor so I guess your over budget already.

Read full topic

item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

So I’m building this computer for $700. I’m trying to save money on whatever I can so this is what I have so far:

Case - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811119077&cm_re=Case-_-11-119-077-_-Product $69.99

GPU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814134064&cm_re=GTX_250--14-134-064--Product

RAM - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231166
$94.99

MOBO - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813138156
$69.99

PSU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817709016&cm_re=PSU--17-709-016--Product
$65.99 - $30.00 Rebate = $35.99

OS - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16832116515&cm_re=Windows_xp--32-116-515--Product
$139.99

Case Fans[x2] - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835150007
$4.07

Total: $~650.00 + shipping = $~700.00

I need to buy the OS so don’t tell me torrent or get Linux please. This is a gaming computer.
I don’t want suggestions on buying cases that include a psu because they normally don’t go above
500w and they normally are cheap and blowout fairly quickly. I need suggestions how to improve the build
or how to keep the build the same and save some money. Thanks. [You can also rate the build 1/10 :D]

P.S:
Since the case doesn’t have room for these fans I plan to just mount them
to the side of the case and hook them up. Will this still be effective? Thanks.
